name: The Best Vegan Macaroni Salad
description: Hands down the best Vegan Macaroni Salad, made with all the classic ingredients and tossed in a super creamy sauce! Perfect for bringing to summer BBQ's/potlucks. Oil free.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup chopped sweet pickles ((or sweet pickle relish))
1 cup raw cashews (OR vegan mayo, see NOTES)

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the cashews: Heat up about 2 cups of water in a tea kettle or small pot. Pour the boiling hot water over the cashews and let them soak while you prepare the noodles.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the cashews: Heat up about 2 cups of water in a tea kettle or small pot. Pour the boiling hot water over the cashews and let them soak while you prepare the noodles.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the macaroni noodles according to package instructions, then immediately rinse well with cold water. Add the drained noodles to a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the macaroni noodles according to package instructions, then immediately rinse well with cold water. Add the drained noodles to a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the celery, red bell pepper, red onion, dill, sweet pickles and add them all to the bowl with the noodles.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the celery, red bell pepper, red onion, dill, sweet pickles and add them all to the bowl with the noodles.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the dressing: Drain the soaked cashews, and then add them to a high powered blender along with the 3/4 cup fresh water, apple cider vinegar, sweet pickle juice, sugar, mustard and salt. Blend on high until very smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the dressing: Drain the soaked cashews, and then add them to a high powered blender along with the 3/4 cup fresh water, apple cider vinegar, sweet pickle juice, sugar, mustard and salt. Blend on high until very smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the dressing over your macaroni salad ingredients and toss until everything is well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes if you can to allow the flavors to meld together. The sauce thickens up in the refrigerator, so simply add a little water and mix until it thins out a bit.
